characters: LEE IS RIGHT THERE NEXT TO HIM
DEAD CENTER ON THE RED CARPET
SMASHING THROUGH A SIGN ON TOP THAT READS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A smoky haze dims the blazing sun.  Skyscrapers sit like watchtowers over the city, where East meets West for five a half million people a day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE AMERICAN EMBASSY - U.S. and Chinese flags side by sid HU LI, dark glasses, EXITS and slowly moves toward a STRE VENDOR across the street. She pays for an order of pork bao; as she takes her first bite we see:

dialogues.speaker: THE EXPLOSION BEHIND HER
dialogues.text: TWO OFFICES ON THE SIXTH FLOOR BLOWN OUT - a huge firebal erupting over one side of the embassy. People panic and run.  Hu Li doesn't even flinch.  She ta a bite of her pork bao as she casually turns to the stunn street vendor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Chinese, subtitled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone better call the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The passenger window rolls down and we see Carter, stylin a Chinese-cut suit.  He's holding a Chinese-English dictionary, leaning out the window - giving his best "do look to two girls in a convertible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (int Chinese)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deng wa lu yun cai-shen wu. The HORRIFIED GIRLS speed off, and Carter turns to Lee, w is driving and singing to his radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...wish they all could be California... wish they all could be California girls... Carter ejects the BEACH BOYS CD from the stereo and TOSSE out of the SUNROOF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I warned you about playing that shit when I'm in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was my CD.  Don't you ever touch a Chinese man's CD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see the way those girls drove off?  I did you a favor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those girls drove off because of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I did was invite them for a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You invited them to get naked and sacrifice a small goat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checking Chinese-English dictionary)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said that?  Which word was "goat?" Lee picks up his CD case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You owe me a copy of the Beach Boys Greatest Hits, Volume Two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be giving me attitude, Lee.  I've been here three days and we haven't done shit.  We haven't been to a club, haven't even talked to a girl.  I'm on vacation, and I want some mu-shu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mu-shu?  You're hungry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not Mu-shu.  Mu-shu.  I want to see some women.  Now stop playing dumb and show me the shu! Carter flips through the dictionary.  A CALL COMES in ove LEE'S CELL PHONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The following conversation is in Chinese, English subtitl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee, there was a bombing at the American Embassy.  Two American translators were killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any leads?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We think it's Ricky Tan.  If you don't want to take the case, I'll understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my responsibility. Lee hangs up the cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that?  Did you just pick up a case?  Did we just take another damn case on my vacation? Lee smiles at Carter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not.  My Superindendent invited us to a club tonight.  Big party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be messing with me, Lee.  I will kick your ass.  I'll hit you so hard you'll end up in the Ming Dynasty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter, would I lie to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. RAVEN CLUB - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter follows Lee out of the car, the two men making the way to the door of the Raven Club.  Carter is combing his hair, getting himself ready for a night on the town, stop when he spots two hot WOMEN walking into the club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I'm talking about.  A real Hong Kong night club.  You want an Altoid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better take one.  Your breath has been a little funky all day.  Let me look at you. Carter looks at Lee.  Fixes his collar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just relax and don't worry about a thing.  I'll hook you up in there.  You got condoms?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take this.  It's a Magnum.  You can fold it in half. Carter dances through the door, Lee follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dark, upscale club that is packed with GANGSTERS, BEAUT GIRLS and CIVILIANS.  Lee and Carter walk in.  Lee is try to keep a low profile as Carter stares up at the stage, w a man sings Karaoke -- the most painful rendition of Mich Jackson's "DON'T STOP 'TILL YOU GET ENOUGH."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll meet you at the bar in ten minutes.  They don't like tourists in here, so try to blend in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blend in?  I'm two feet taller than everyone here.  Where you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bathroom. Lee walks off, trying not to be seen as Carter steps up t the bar, takes a seat next to TWO CHINESE THUGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you boys doing tonight? The thugs ignore Carter as he motions to the stage, where OLD MAN continues to sing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is the worst singing I've ever heard.  That sounds like something you'd hear in prison after lights out. The thugs continue to ignore Carter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee makes his way down a hallway -- looks through an open door - sees a private room.  Several TRIADS are using hi- MACHINES to count stacks of AMERICAN HUNDRED DOLLAR BILLS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get closer to my body now.  And just love me, till you don't know how... Lee steps back into shadow -- does a double take as he realizes he's hearing Carter belting out "DON'T STOP 'TIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A room full of Chinese sitting with their mouths open, watching Carter on the Karaoke stage doing a dead-on Mich Jackson, singing his heart out.  Dancing and making eyes few of the smitten women who are watching him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering from side of stage)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter, get off that stage!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding, they love me.  I'm a star, Lee.  A god to these people! Carter resumes singing, really getting down.  Moonwalking the EDGE of the STATE where Lee PULLS HIM OFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a gangster bar, we're here undercover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew you were lying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it, why are you ruining my night?  I'm just starting to have fun. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well fine then, go ahead, pull your badge and do your thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we're here for information, to find out where a man named Ricky Tan is.  We must tread softly and keep our ears open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tread softly?  Who taught you how to roost a bar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter, you don't understand.  These men are Fu-Cang-Long Triads.  Part of the most deadly gang in China.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, are you crazy?  You think that scares me?  I'm from  L.A.  We invented gangs.  We were having gang wars before anybody even thought about it.  We get royalties from other gangs.  Now gimme your badge and gun and I'll show you how it's done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  You are a civilian.  In China, I am Michael Jackson, and you are Toto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean Tito.  We had  Toto for dinner last night. Before Lee can react, Carter has lifted Lee's badge and g Carter bounds back on stage, pulls the plug on the music fires three SHOTS into the ceiling, silencing the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Chinese)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deng wa lu yun, shen wu wattu masu wang lui. Nobody moves.  Strange looks from the crowd.  Carter turn Lee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd I say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just said you're their worst nightmare - and to line their mothers up for a milking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.  C'mon, get up here and help me out. Reluctantly, Lee gets on stage.  More looks from the Chin as Carter speaks, Lee translating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, all the Triads and ugly women go to that side, all fine ass women on this side. Nobody moves.  Carter fires two more shots in the ceiling

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's try this again.  Who here knows Ricky Tan, raise your hand. Nobody moves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who here is named Lee?  Raise your hand. Nobody moves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I know you're lying.   The crowd still hasn't moved.  Except in the back, where spots several GANGSTERS leaving.  As Lee runs off stage -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as they run out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I come back and catch y'all singing Michael Jackson and you're all going to jail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee and Carter run into the street, just in time to see H and several gangsters round a corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop!  LAPD! Lee takes off and chases them on foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The far end of the street is BLOCKED BY MARKET STALLS.  T GANGSTERS look around frantically.  An apartment building under CONSTRUCTION, massive BAMBOO SCAFFOLDING top to bot Their only way out is UP. Lee and Carter dash around the corner to see the gangster SWARMING UP THE SCAFFOLDING.  Lee wastes no time going af them.  With a running start, he JAMS A FOOT on the wall a VAULTS to the BOTTOM RUNG, GRABS HOLD AND SWINGS UP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on, Lee.  I'm coming. Carter jumps to grab hold of the scaffolding.  NOT EVEN CLOSE.  He backs up -- he's gonna take a running start! ABOVE - LEE REACHES 4 GANGSTERS.  They all tear off the LENGTHS OF BAMBOO and square off.  The clatter of wood against wood as they beat at each other.  Wrestling over pole, Lee FLINGS TWO of the GANGSTERS over the edge. BELOW, Carter has hold of the bottom rung, STRAINING MIGH to pull himself up.  Just as he gets his chin above the bar... snap!  It BREAKS and he drops.  Then... WHAM!  WHAM!  The two gangsters CRASH LAND ON EITHER side CARTER.  HE takes one look at their pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget this... He dashes into the stairwell.  ABOVE, the last two GANGST come at Lee.  He stomps down, levering up floor boards, w SEE-SAWS them off-balance.  With the advantage, he BATTER them with his bamboo pole and knocks them off.  He climbs after the GANGSTER LEADER. ON HU LI and the GANGSTERS Coming over the crest of the hill, seeing Carter climbing the hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee pulls himself up onto the roof, takes a few steps whe WHAM!  He is clocked by a 16-foot BAMBOO POLE.  Lee TOPPL OVER THE EDGE!  We see his adversary for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: HU LI
dialogues.text: As she steps to the edge... BOOM!  The STAIRWELL DOOR FLI OPEN and CARTER EMERGES.  Gun low and ready.  Hu Li is go

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (out of breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeze!  Nobody move! Carter goes to the edge and sees Lee hanging on a pole be Carter is blind-sided by Hu Li. She takes one sultry step towards him, then twists her he and WINDMILLS a HARD KICK that sends Carter FLYING OFF TH

dialogues.speaker: ROOF
dialogues.text: He falls along the side of the building.  He manages to g the end of a BAMBOO POLE that juts out from the scaffoldi

dialogues.speaker: LEE IS RIGHT THERE NEXT TO HIM
dialogues.text: They're hanging side-by-side, holding on for their lives. Li looks down at them.  She has no weapon to finish them She turns and runs, disappearing in the night.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER AND LEE
dialogues.text: holding on with all their strength.  The bamboo is starti to bend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I wanted was a little mu-shu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try to land on your feet. Carter looks down at a rancid dumpster below them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe I flew ten-thousand miles for this shit. The POLE BREAKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter and Lee drive through Hong Kong, the two men ridin silence, bruised and covered in garbage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lied to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sorry.  I got somebody's old chopsticks stuck in my ass, so don't tell me you're sorry.  Just take me home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No time.  There was an explosion at the American Embassy today -- two American translators were killed. Carter takes this in.  Can't believe his own bad luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that Ricky Tan, he's the one who blew up the Embassy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee and Carter walk into a massive COURTYARD, where thirt year olds are going through their warm up routines.   MASTER FU, 60's, wears a BLACK ROBE as he teaches his kid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you right now, I'm tired of this shit.  There's two billion Chinese - let one of them be your partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This won't take long.  Master Fu barks out a barrage of SHAOLIN FIGHTING STANCES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dragon kick! Like well-trained army, the students YELL AND KICK HARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lotus block! The students YELL and form an "X" with their arms.  Maste notices Carter and Lee watching from the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twisting Tiger! No response.  The students exchange baffled looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring straight at Lee)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twisting Tiger! Lee may be a big rusty, but he puts on a shit-kicking mov that leaves the students blown away.  Lee smiles, basking the glow... ...until he sees Master Fu's disappointment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't I teach you to always arch your back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bowing, humbled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Master. While Lee follows Master Fu, Carter stands in front of th YEAR OLDS, who sit motionless around a fighting circle.  Carter starts stretching his legs, warming up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was watching you kids.  My name is Carter, LAPD, and I'm a third degree black belt.  At least that's what I tell the girls at the Holiday Health Spa where I work out. Carter throws a series of QUICK PUNCHES, but the kids hav reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me give you kids some tips.  The key to Kung Fu is the follow through.  Why don't you stand up. THE KIDS DON'T MOVE, no reaction.  Carter continues to th punches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead, kick me, hit me.  I'll show you how to block.  Come on, stand up, give me your best shot -- try to kick right to my head. The kids still don't move.  Carter, working up a sweat fr shadow fighting, takes off his JACKET, DRAPING IT over th HOLY BUDDHA behind him -- a mistake.  He swings back arou to face the kids and NEVER SEES THE KICK that sends him flying back onto the mat.  He looks around and sees ALL o the kids STANDING, in FIGHTING POSITION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's pretty good.  Which one of you kids did that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee and Master Fu walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need your help, Master.  I'm seeking a man who used to train with you.  He's become a killer - the worst kind of animal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Animals kill only from hunger or fear.  The man you seek is lower than a serpent.   (faces Lee)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...he kills for money. In the b.g., we see the kids leaping acrobatically over Carter from all sides.  Carter, frustrated, tries to grab kids out of the air as they fly by, but they elude him. disappear O.S. Lee and Master Fu walk another moment, Master Fu lost in thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was the best I ever trained, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky Tan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Your father. (Lee reacts)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father and Ricky Tan were my favorite students... and for such awful things to happen as they did -- Lee cuts off Master Fu's reminisces -- he's obviously uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I find Ricky Tan? AGAIN IN THE B.G., Carter and the flying kids go zipping in the other direction, disappear O.S. Master Fu pats the SOIL around a struggling plant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A seeding spends its entire life reaching towards Heaven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, Master, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The answers you seek can be found in Heaven on Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heaven on Earth?  Master, I don't understand. (working it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A temple, where Heaven is on Earth?  A mountain, where Earth reaches for the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a massage parlor downtown.  "Heaven on Earth."  You will find your answers there. Lee bows to Master Fu, slowly turns to walk back down the pathway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!  Put a c-note in the jar. Lee puts a few bills in the jar, heads down a pathway.  Master Fu walks over and takes the cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheap bastard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee emerges from the path, stops when he sees Carter -- t students headlocked under each arm, another two scissor locked between his legs, holding another two down with hi hands, and sitting on the last one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's how you use the LAPD choke hold.  Now start practicing and don't make me come back here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter...you ready to have some fun!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A neon light hangs above the upscale massage parlor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just follow my lead and act like a tourist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am a tourist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee and Carter walk into an upscale MASSAGE PARLOR and st in a lobby.  SOFT MUSIC is playing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good afternoon, gentlemen. Lee bows, followed by Carter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Chinese)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My friend is on vacation, from America.  I want to show him a good time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you American?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bring American money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding up a Platinum AmEx)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never leave home without it. (to Lee)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee, this one's on me.  You save your money. The Hostess takes Carter by the arm, walks over to a HIDD SLIDING DOOR - slides it open to reveal TWENTY BEAUTIFUL WOMEN.  Carter truly is in Heaven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get massage from Chinese girl before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  It's my first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You pick any girl for you and your friend. Carter looks like a kid in a candy store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any girl?  Okay.  Let's start with that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes, she's very nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is nice.  But I am very tense.  I'm gonna need a lot of massages.  I'll take that one, too.  How you doin', baby?  And...that one in pink.  She can do my feet. Lee elbows Carter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said I could pick any girl I want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, hurry up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  You don't break in front of a black man in a buffet line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Lee)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your friend have big appetite. (handing ROBES to Lee and Carter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please put these on and wait upstairs in the quiet room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWENTY MEN in SILK ROBES lie in reclining chairs, women massaging their feet and hands.  There are BIG SCREEN TV' showing nature films, relaxation music playing in the background.  Lee and Carter sit in the quiet room dressed in MATCHING PURPLE ROBES.  Lee wears SLIPPERS, Carter wears his HIGH TOPS.  Carter is enjoying a hand and neck massage at the time.  A WOMAN walks over and hands them each a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I'm on vacation.  I knew you'd come through, Lee. LEE doesn't respond.  LEE IS STARING AT SOMEONE ON THE FA SIDE OF THE ROOM.  A man who radiates a unique blend of sophistication and brutality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over there -- that's Ricky Tan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Ricky Tan?  He's four feet tall.  I'll go over with you right now, shake him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a very dangerous man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a dangerous man.  You're not gonna ruin my massage because of some midget in a house coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm calling for back up! Lee gets up from a chair, hurriedly exits. Carter looks at RICKY TAN -- sitting quietly in his chair with his LAPTOP COMPUTER on his knees.  Carter makes a decision, gets up and walks towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky Tan, I've been looking all over for you.  Get up. Tan looks up for a moment, a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm busy at the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said get on your feet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you, Detective Carter, right?  You're Lee's American friend.  Enjoying your visit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Lee's new muscle, his right arm -- and don't let the robe fool you.  This is the only color they had left.  Now get up! Tan laughs, goes back to his laptop.  CARTER GRABS THE LA from Ricky and throws it across the room - SHATTERING IT against the wall.  Ricky glances at his men who are seate around the room waiting to move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you to get on your feet! Having heard the commotion, Lee arrives by Carter's side, breathless, as Tan looks up, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee, I've missed you, brother. (getting up, giving Lee a hug)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard about the two Americans, I'm so sorry, you must be under great pressure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must come with me for questioning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.  I've got girls and chicken and hot oil waiting for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so... A nod of Ricky Tan's head, and TEN LARGE MEN in robes and towels spring out of reclining chairs -- menacingly facin Lee and Carter.  A beat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to pay you for that laptop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's no problem.  But I must excuse myself, inspector.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Chief Inspector, he got promoted. Tan bows to Lee and Carter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations.  And good day. As Tan starts to exit, Lee and Carter move to intercept h But they are blocked by TAN'S MEN. Lee grabs one of the men's towels and pulls it off.  The covers his naked body.  Lee is grabbed by one of the othe henchmen, but he escapes and begins kicking ass, using th towel and his own robe to block and wrap another man's ar blocking, kicking, and punching everything in sight -- al the while managing to keep his privates covered with a to his robe, or some other found object. Carter, meanwhile, uses his quick hands to send several m flying back -- grabbing a towel of one of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ref: his privates)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn!  No wonder you're pissed off. Carter uses the towel like Lee did to block and trap one the men's punches. In the middle of fighting, Lee is suddenly exposed -- he flinches to cover himself and is punched from behind.  Momentarily stunned, he's lifted from behind -- two men throwing him out the front door. Carter is also overpowered by two men, who lift him over their shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky Tan's black limo SCREECHES to a stop.  The door fli open and Lee and Carter are TOSSED out onto the highway.  Both men are completely naked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A packed street - Lee and Carter dodging in and out of people.  The CAMERA PANS and we see Lee and Carter from behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn you got a small ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look at my ass!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The station is packed with Americans -- FBI AGENTS, SECRE SERVICE... they've set up shop right in the middle of the bullpen. SUPERINDENDENT CHIN is arguing with SPECIAL AGENT STERLIN 50-year old hard ass who is in charge of this circus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chin, you have been ordered by the Ministry of Public Security to assist the FBI and Secret Service with our investigation, to provide us with whatever we need.  If you have information, it belongs to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is still Hong Kong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two Americans have been killed on United States Government property -- this is our investigation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief Inspector Lee will brief your people...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  He will report to me.  Do we understand each other? SUDDENLY ALL EYES turn as Carter and Lee enter the bullpe Out of breath, still robed: Lee covering himself with a t can lid, Carter using a red construction cone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (humiliated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is...Chief Inspector Lee.  The detective in charge of our investigation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put a diaper on him, Chin.  I want to talk to the great Inspector Lee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shades are down as Lee frantically gets dressed, putt on a suit and fixing his tie.  Carter finishes putting on a BLACK CHINESE STYLE SUIT fro Lee's closet, then moves for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to Heaven on Earth.  I need my damn passport back.  I'm going home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.  Go home.  Who needs you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why you mad at me?  You needed back-up, so I backed you up.  I was about to take out Ricky Tan and those bodyguards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop!  I'm sick of your bullshit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My bullshit?  I'm not the one who goes to a karaoke bar filled with gangsters!  I'm not the one who goes to massage parlors to bust crime lords!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my job!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're pathetic, man.  When's the last time you had some fun?  When's the last time you took a night off, had a date?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have plenty of dates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?  When's the last time you had some Mu-shu  Let's hear it, Lee, when was it?  Year of the rat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You would never understand my life.  You're not Chinese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you ain't black! The two men look at each other for a long BEAT.  Lee quic walks out, slamming the door behind him, leaving Carter h dressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee walks in, sees Sterling sitting at Chin's desk.  Chin stands in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee, this is Special Agent Sterling from the United States Secret Service.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Secret Service?  Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I'm about to tell you cannot leave this room.  The men who were killed yesterday were not American translators.  They were undercover U.S. customs agents trying to break a Triad smuggling ring.  We don't know what they're transporting out of Hong Kong, but whatever it is, it got the agents killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can we help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay the hell out of our way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can get to Ricky Tan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know all about Tan.  That's why we're leaving him out there as bait.  We think this is a lot bigger than just Ricky Tan and his Fu-Cang-Long Triads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter is on the phone, his feet on Lee's desk.  As he ta he opens a drawer, pulls out a wad of cash and pockets it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, you're gonna have to speak up.  I'm on a car phone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAPTAIN DIEL sits behind his desk talking on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it true, Carter?  Are you in Hong Kong right now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hong Kong?  I'm not in Hong Kong.  I'm in Hollywood -- right at Sunset and Vine, two minutes from the station.  How about I pick you up right now and take you to dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nine-thirty in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I say dinner?  I meant diner.  Biscuits and gravy, you love that shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know what happened yesterday, Carter?  I was officially nominated for the Commissioner's post for the LAPD.  There was a dinner last night, two hundred LAPD officers were there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two hundred cops?  Was Mario Sanchez there?  He owes me money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've waited my whole life for this job, but I don't have a shot in hell of getting it.  Do you know why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it because of the hookers, sir?  You tell them there's no crime in being lonely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Carter.  The reason I'm screwed is because the entire department is about to find out the stolen credit cards we impounded were used to buy two first class upgrades to Hong Kong.  And what the hell is Heaven on Earth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I'm working on a big case over here -- and by the time I get back they're gonna make you Governor.  Captain, you there?  Hello?  Shit! As Carter walks out the DOOR, he brushes past HU LI, who standing in the hallway disguised as a FED EX DELIVERY PERSON.  Carter checks her out as he exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARTER starts walking down the street, making his way pas outdoor BUTCHER MARKET, getting strange looks from locals tourists alike.  He motions to an OLD WOMAN who is sellin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doing?  Can you direct me to the Heaven on Earth massage parlor?   The OLD WOMAN stares at Carter, starts motioning to her C filled with birds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't eat live birds.  I like my birds dead and deep fried.  You ever been to Popeyes? The Woman takes out a bird, holds up a HATCHET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, don't do that, I had a big lunch.  I'm warning you, I'm a police officer -- just put the blade down and let the bird go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee walks out of the Captain's office, heads for his own office - but never gets there. AN EXPLOSION rips through the second floor of the station Lee diving for safety as glass and debris shoot over his head.  Sheer pandemonium as Lee quickly looks up at his destroyed office, tries to get to his feet. STUNNED POLICE OFFICERS and DETECTIVES are crowded around Lee's office, looking at the rubble.  Lee pushes through crowd -- it's all smoke and fire.  Now way anyone held ba by the heat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter!  CARTER!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter walks down the street holding a CAGE WITH A LIVE R BIRD inside.  He stops a MAN who is sweeping in front of store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doing?  I'm looking for Heaven on Earth. The man stares at Carter, watches as he pulls out his:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shan-shui cao guo-jiu, pao gai niu tao zi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wish to spank my sister with a ping pong paddle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No man, I was just asking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait here.  I'll go see if she's awake. As the man walks into his store, Carter runs off. Pause. Carter strolls back INTO FRAME, peering into the store to if it's worth staying...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee sits by himself in shock.  Superindendent Chin approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All he wanted was some mu-shu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay, Lee? Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I have to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter finally makes his way to the massage parlor, movin for the FRONT DOOR when he sees RICKY TAN EXIT.  Carter d to the side and watches as Ricky climbs into the back of waiting Daimler. The Daimler drives off.  Carter rushes to the middle of t street with a determined look on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna solve this case myself.  Taxi! Carter flags down a CAB, jumps in the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAB DRIVER turns to Carter, who motions to the limo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow that limo. The Cab Driver continues to stare at Carter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You understand what I'm saying?  Follow that car!  Where it goes, you go!  This is a chase -- we are chasing that limo! (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are still parked -- we're not moving!  This is the opposite of chasing -- drive the car or I will kill you! The driver slowly turns, holding out his hand.  Carter fi in his pocket hands the cab driver a wad of cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you speak my language.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee drives, misty-eyed.  RAP MUSIC playing over the stere Lee turns it up, slowly moving his head to the music, in tribute to Carter. His CELL PHONE rings, he turns down the music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee, we just got a call from the harbor patrol.  Ricky Tan is throwing a little party on his boat tonight.  Victoria harbor.  If you don't want to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you tell Sterling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let him find out on his own.  I want the Hong Kong police handling this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Lee hangs up.  A look of intensity.  He CRANKS the RAP MU up, a man on a mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A 190-FOOT YACHT is anchored in Victoria Harbor.  Ricky T walks along the top deck with HU LI, disappearing into a crowd of people who are partying on the ship. Carter steps out of the cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay here.  I'll be right back.  You understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  I understand. Carter steps out of the cab, which immediately drives off leaving him alone on the docks. Carter looks around the dock -- a pull up valet station parking fancy cars, RICH PEOPLE getting on the boat as th names are checked off a list by two DOORMEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge PARTY, a live band plays for a crowd of business m politicians and beautiful women - a who's who of Hong Kon CARTER walks up to the front of the boat -- TWO DOORMEN HOLDING clipboards immediately stop him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Invitation, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm with the band.  I'm the lead singer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The band has been playing over an hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got held up at a wedding in Tai Koo.  Ricky here yet, I need to get his requests. As Carter walks past the doorman --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last party all he wanted was Sting -- not one person danced.  Tonight I'm doing Superfreak, I don't care what he says.  Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Tan is not to be disturbed by the help. Carter turns back to the doorman, grabs him by the collar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help?  I'm not the help, man -- I'm the star.  That's my band up there -- I control the mood, the groove, the atmosphere. Carter cuts a smoking DANCE MOVE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you do that? (man shakes head "no")

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why you're down here and I'm up there.  Now this is my party -- don't forget it! Carter walks onto the ship, starts singing to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SHIP'S HORN SOUNDS, the yacht starts to head out to s Lee steps out of his car, sees the yacht is pulling out o the slip.  He runs along the side of the boat, has no cho but to jump from the end of the pier, landing hard on the side of the ship, somehow holding onto a PORTHOLE WINDOW. clings to the yacht, then throws himself toward a hanging LIFEBOAT, climbs up the side and jumps toward the TOP RAI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Carter walks through the ship, he grabs a handful of f from a waiter, his eyes searching the crowd, rounds a cor - almost stepping right into HU LI, who's approaching STE REIGN.  Steven Reign is in his 50's -- perfectly groomed, impeccably dressed - his looks and bearing say one thing money.  He's got the big party smile on, but as Hu Li arrives, Reign's face shifts and his eyes go dead -- the billionai as sociopath. Carter steps back, but sees Reign Whisper to Hu Li.  Cart hides and turns away as Hu Li instinctively scans the roo for signs of trouble.  He heads into the main party. Carter stops walking when he comes upon ISABELLA MOLINA, stunning brunette, sitting at the bar drinking a glass of champagne.  Carter lights her cigarette for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doing, baby?  My name is Prince Mubutu from Nigeria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabella Molina, from San Juan.  That seat is taken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in mangled Spanish)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: San Juan!  You must know my good friend Pedro Martinez Hernandez Hector Elizondo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in English)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, you looked like you traveled in the best circles.  But hey, I understand.  Make yourself at home, Isabella.  Champagne, caviar, whatever you want.  My ship is your ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is your ship?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.  I'm the owner, the Captain -- you can call me El Capitan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: El Capitan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to play games with you, Isabella.  I like you.  I can see myself with you -- in one of those bathrooms over there in about five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm very tempted.  It's such a beautiful yacht.  What's it called?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Called?  What's my ship called? (he has no idea)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...it's called the S.S. Minnow Johnson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The S.S. Minow Johnson.  Funny, the name on the back was "Red Dragon."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red Dragon?  You sure about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure, because this is my friend's yacht.  And it's his party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your friend's ship? (looking around)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, man.  I must've walked onto the wrong yacht.  I knew there was a reason my keys didn't work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking seat next to Isabella)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's your friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody who got on the wrong yacht.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second.  You're Steven Reign?  You're big time.  You own all them big hotels.  What are you doing in Hong Kong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ushering away Isabella)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just in town for the weekend, taking in the sights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enjoy the party, Mr. Carter. Carter nods, waves.  Steven Reign and Isabella walk away. Carter's watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee makes his way toward a STAIRCASE that is blocked by a BODYGUARD.  He quickly disarms the guard and grabs him by throat, pushing him against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky Tan.  Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's asking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hong Kong Police.  He killed a detective today and he's not getting away with it.  Now where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Tell us!  And don't play games or we'll kick your lying ass! Lee slowly turns around and looks at Carter, who is stand right behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who died?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Yu?  Never met him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not Yu.  You!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you understand the words that are coming out of my mouth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody understands the words that are coming out of your mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your hands in the air. Lee and Carter turn to see FOUR BODYGUARDS standing in fr of them with GUNS in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky Tan is expecting you.  INT. RICKY TAN'S YACHT - MAIN CABIN - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks like HUGH HEFNER'S BEDROOM complete with ROUND B and SUNKEN BAR.  Ricky Tan sits in front of a big screen satellite TV screaming at the Lakers.  Hu Li opens the do and the bodyguards lead Lee into the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Shaq, hit a damn free-throw!  You can do it, big guy.

dialogues.speaker: ON TV
dialogues.text: We see Shaq miss his free throw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!  He still doesn't follow through.  I just lost five grand. Tan turns off the TV, turns to Lee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't we go on the deck, get some air...and some privacy. (to Hu Li)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave us alone. Hu Li hesitates, upset at being dismissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Lee)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you have your partner wait for us outside?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't his partner, I'm a tourist.  I got proof.  See, I got a mini-bar key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Carter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll meet you on the main deck in ten minutes. Carter pulls Lee aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, leave you alone so he can cap you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay, you go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why the hell should you believe him?  He had us beat up.  Naked.  That's nasty shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember I told you my father was a policeman? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky Tan was his partner for ten years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is going on here? No answer.  Carter holds Lee's glance for a beat, then tu and walks the other way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tan and Lee reach the upper deck, where they are alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Despite what people suspect...what you suspect --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't. Ricky Tan hears the steel in Lee's voice, acknowledges it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... if your father were alive, I would be turning to him now. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't blow up the American Embassy, but I believe some of my people did.  My enemies are trying to frame me. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a war going on within the Triads -- and I am going to lose.  My name has been written into the book of death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police can protect you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody can protect me.  I'll make a deal with you, Lee.  But only iff you'll get me out of Hong Kong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me why they killed the customs agents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a ship, in the Hong Kong Harbor... Hu Li BURSTS onto the deck, flanked by FOUR BODYGUARDS. Ricky Tan screams something at Hu Li in Chinese.  Hu Li screams back as SHE EMPTIES HER GUN INTO RICKY'S CHEST. falls back, over the rail, and into the water. Lee MOVES TOWARDS HU LI, but the four bodyguards are on L attacking from all sides.  Hu Li exits as Lee tries to fi off the bodyguards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reactions from the crowd as GUNSHOTS echo from the deck above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hu Li moves quickly down the hallway, rounding a corner a suddenly goes FLYING, landing flat on her face. It's Carter, who ran to the sound of the gunshot, and TRI Hu Li with his leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, get your hands up. Hu Li backflips up -- kicking Carter in the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee takes down Bodyguard #1, but is still fighting three one.  A furious exchange of acrobatic blows between Lee a Bodyguard #2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter and Hu Li face off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna piece of me?  C'mon, I'll give you a little LAPD ass kickin'. Hu Li savages Carter with a series of punishing blows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee manages to defeat Bodyguards #3 and #4.  As he catche his breath the sound of a SPEED BOAT starting its engines

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hu Li! Lee runs to the rail -- looks down to see a SPEEDBOAT starting to pull away from the ship.  Hu Li jumps onboard moving boat. Lee starts to turn for the stairs, running down towards t stern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee and Carter run up to the stern at the same time -- watching helplessly as Hu Li gets away in the speed boat. Carter turns his head, sees -- -- STEVEN REIGN at the other end of the boat, watching Hu escape, not at all behaving like a panicky billionaire sh during a gangland shooting.  Wordlessly, Reign disappears back into the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The yacht is anchored.  A few TRIADS led away in handcuff Thrown into PATROL CARS that have surrounded the docks. Sterling, Chin, Lee and Carter on the dock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite a night, Inspector.  Ricky Tan was our only bait, and now he's gone.  You finally got your revenge - at the expense of a U.S. Government investigation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What "revenge" is he talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if the Fu-Cang-Long paid you to get rid of Tan, or whether it was a pure vendetta killing -- but you're off this case.  I don't ever want to see you again, you got that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you, Secret Service Man, what are you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay out of it, Carter.  You're going back to L.A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine with me. Sterling walks away disgusted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry Lee, but my orders are to fully cooperate with the Secret Service. Lee nods a respectful but bitter acknowledgment.  Chin motions for two uniformed Hong Kong police officers to approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to police officers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Escort Detective Carter to the airport --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell no. The Hong Kong police officers produce HANDCUFFS.  Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Lee)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.  But don't expect me to talk to you. Carter stalks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't push me, Carter.  I'm in no mood for your bullshit. Carter gets in Lee's face.  The two men look like they're about to come to blows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you gonna do about it, grasshopper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bitch slap you into Bangkok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me your best shot, you flat assed mama's boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be talking about my mama.  Or my ass!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard your mama pulls a rickshaw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  She's a school teacher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not very good at this, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good at what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it. A long beat while Lee considers what to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five years ago, my father was Chief Inspector working a big international smuggling case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask me if I give a shit. Lee waits a beat, then drops the bombshell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky Tan killed my father. Carter is suddenly all ears, listening intently now to Le

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He found out his partner, Tan, had been working for the Triads all along. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before my father could prove it, he was killed in the line of duty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the hell did Tan get away with it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the evidence against him disappeared, the smuggling case was unsolved.  Tan resigned and went over to the Triads openly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is about your Daddy's death?  Hell, Lee, you know my father died on the job.  You could have told me... (realizing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is about more than all that, isn't it?  This is about your Daddy's last case, right? Lee's caught, fibs badly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, that would be crazy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You thought the "Customs Agents get blown up" and "smuggling" and "Ricky Tan" and you put it all together and came up with a five year old case.  That's why you didn't tell me what we were doing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you'd think it was crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  I know.  I am sorry. Lee inclines his head, stiffly, turns and walks toward hi car.  Carter watches him.  Finally he rolls his eyes and yells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So are you getting on the plane or not?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, we still got time to order the Kosher meal.  Always get the kosher meal, they bring it first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I cannot go to LA... Carter steps close, and for a second we see the man and t cop beneath the attitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sounds impossible --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- but if somebody gave me the chance to square up my father's death, I'd go to hell to do it. Carter turns, walks away without looking back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to figure out why they killed your Daddy, get on the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why LA?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still not turning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess you're going to have to trust me on this one.  INT. 747 PASSENGER COMPARTMENT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter and Lee are getting comfortable among all the othe passengers, preparing to take off.  Lee has a moment of doubt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should go back.  Ricky Tan mentioned a boat in Hong Kong Harbor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee, let me introduce you to the Carter Theory of Criminal Investigation: Follow the Rich White Man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow the Rich White Man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost, but you've got to say "Rich White Man" all run together like it's one word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow the RichWhiteMan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not bad.  Now every crime, somewhere, has a rich white man taking his cut.  Every single one.  Now in our case, we know the rich white man is Steven Reign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big hotel billionaire.  He was on Ricky Tan's boat ordering Hu Li around just before Ricky got smoked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know he's our man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because when the shooting started he was way too cool.  See most white people, when there's shooting, they either hide in a toilet or start screaming high pitched like "Aaaahhh!!! Aaaahh!!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sound like that all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black people keep their cool when the shit goes down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.  But not like Asians.  We never panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, what about when Godzilla was coming?  You people were screaming your asses off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tell me where I can find this Steven Reign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same place you find all RichWhiteMen. (a tray arrives)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gefilte Fish.  Lox and bagel.  I love this stuff.  Here, try it with a smear.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO REVEAL --
dialogues.text: Carter standing at a window holding high-powered binocula Lee standing next to him.  WE ARE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cartons of Chinese food are all over the sleazy, run down hotel room.  The LIGHTS LOW, the curtains open a crack.

dialogues.speaker: THE REIGN HOTEL
dialogues.text: Traveling up the side of the Reign Hotel.  Stopping at th penthouse floor - where we see ISABELLA talking with Stev Reign in a hotel room.  After a BEAT, Reign walks to the door. Carter flips the binoculars to Lee, who starts watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's definitely the woman from Ricky Tan's boat, and she's staying in his suite at his hotel, I told you this would work out.  They still just talking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just left.  Kissed her on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll be back soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at her.  Now, wake me in an hour, I'll take over. Lee lowers the binoculars, turns to Carter, who is trying sleep on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter, there's something I have to tell you.  You were right about what you said in Hong Kong.  All I do is work.  Never take a day off.  It's all I have right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I didn't mean to call you pathetic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truth is, I haven't had any mu-shu in six months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You pull a muscle or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My fiancee left me over the summer -- a month before our wedding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Lee.  Why did she leave you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a long story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me guess, she couldn't handle the cop thing -- never knowing if you were dead or alive.  I've seen it a million times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  It was my singing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hated my voice.  Said it drove her crazy.  I sang to her all the time - in bed - in the shower - I thought she liked it.  She finally told me it was driving her crazy. Carter stares at Lee for a long BEAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee, maybe it's best if we don't discuss our personal lives.  Let's die curious. LEE LIFTS THE BINOCULARS - turns back to the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's she doing?

dialogues.speaker: ON ISABELLA
dialogues.text: She walks to the bedroom, where we see her through SHEER CURTAINS.  Slowly taking off her coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee?  You okay? Lee's eyes go wide as Isabella drops her coat and starts unbutton her blouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's just standing around -- not doing much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just don't fall asleep.  Sooner or later something's gonna happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll try to stay awake.  It's so boring. Isabella starts to remove her blouse.  Lee starting to sw as he watches her undress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slow down, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.  I said nothing. Lee lowers his binoculars, steps away from the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it hot in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hot?  I'm freezing my ass off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna go in the hall and get a bucket of ice.  You want some ice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?   Lee stares at Carter, looks dazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's getting undressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme the binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  It's not right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme the binoculars or I will shoot you. Lee hands Carter the binoculars, then turns his back as Carter watches to the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's she doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sweet glory hallelujah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to hear this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skirt just came off.  She's in black bra and panties -- Victoria Secret Spring Catalogue, page 27 -- wait a sec - there's a tattoo on her left thigh... it looks like Snoopy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snoopy?  I love Snoopy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She just took her hair down.  Now she's going for the bra -- the clasp is in front -- she's using both hands. (to Lee)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better get that ice. Lee steps in front of Carter, blocking his view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough.  We shouldn't be doing this! Isabella suddenly drops undressing and walks back to the living room to pick up the PHONE.  We see her clearly now bra and panties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is our job.  We took an oath as police officers.  If we don't do this, who will?  Firemen? Lee backs off, and Carter steps back to the window.  He s Isabella hang up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a sec - what the hell is that between her legs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's reaching into her panties -- something is strapped to her leg.  Oh, God...please don't let it be a dick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't believe this shit -- it's a microphone.  Lee, she's wired...

dialogues.speaker: ISABELLA
dialogues.text: As she turns to the window.  A TAPE RECORDER in hand.  Sh puts the recording device away, walks back into the bedro and puts on a robe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's walking back towards the door. BINOCULARS P.O.V. We see Isabella wearing a robe - standing at the door of hotel room talking with someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opened the door.  Someone is delivering a package. BINOCULARS P.O.V. Inside the hotel room WE SEE HU LI handing her a package.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee...it's the girl who delivered the package to your office.  It's a bomb! Lee and Carter bolt on the move - sprinting out of the ro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabella closes the door.  She BRINGS THE BOMB WITH HER a she walks into the bedroom --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter and Lee run across the street, heading towards the entrance of the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee and Carter sprint out the Penthouse Elevators, runnin down the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabella takes her robe off, glances at the package, pick up and starts to open it as Lee and Carter come BURSTING THROUGH the BEDROOM DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: Carter and Lee stare at Isabella, who stands in bra and panties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn girl, you fine. Lee lowers his eyes as Isabella looks at him, grabbing th BOMB, Carter following him as they sprint out the bedroom

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee and Carter run out the suite - Lee throwing the BOMB toward the END OF THE HALL as he and Carter dive to the floor. Nothing happens. Lee looks up, SEES a HOTEL EMPLOYEE pushing a room servic CART, about to walk right past the package --

dialogues.speaker: GET DOWN
dialogues.text: Lee and Carter run back to the bomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pick it up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your turn!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need a turn! Carter picks it up, starts running with it through the ha heading for the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Throw it! Carter is about to throw it in, when HE SEES AN OLDER COU STANDING INSIDE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want us to hold the elevator?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the hell away from here! Carter is still holding the bomb, doesn't know what to do with it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stairs! Carter throws him the bomb, and Lee runs to the stairs --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee is about to throw the bomb down the stairwell -- when sees TWO MAIDS WALKING toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of the building! Lee looks horrified as he hangs onto the package, has no choice but to throw it back to Carter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roof!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee and Carter burst through the roof door - Carter tryin hold the bomb as far away from himself as possible.  He looks over the side for a place to dump it - the stree are filled with PEOPLE AND CARS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!  There's people down there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's people up here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get it out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it! Lee takes the bomb, quickly ROLLS IT across the roof -- L and Carter diving to the ground once again as the bomb sl to the center of the roof - COMING TO A STOP RIGHT IN FRO OF ISABELLA.  She's wearing a bathrobe now, clearly pisse off as she slowly bends down and picks up the package.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get on your feet. Lee and Carter stand and face Isabella - watch as Isabell begins to open the package.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't do that!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a bomb. Isabella opens the package, removing a stack of a HUNDRED DOLLAR BILLS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see, no bomb.  Now stay away before I throw you both in jail for obstruction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Throw us in jail?  I'm about to bust you right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm an undercover agent for the United States Secret Service.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do we know you're not lying?  Let me see your badge. Isabella opens her bathrobe -- WE SEE a small BADGE pinne her bra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see it again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can help you.  I'm a detective in Hong Kong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know who you are, Inspector Lee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you know I'm not walking away from this case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to get out of sight.  Come down to my suite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (she locks the door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I've been working this case for months now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's your story?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They think I'm a crooked customs agent. Lee examines the stack of HUNDRED DOLLAR BILLS from Hu Li package.  Carter checks out the suite, pocketing some of food from the mini fridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this a payoff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  It's a sample.  You guys ever heard of the Superbill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a myth.  Some kind of counterfeit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's much more than a counterfeit.  14 out of 15 world banks can't tell the difference.  The paper is Crane linen blend -- and the bills are printed on U.S. Intaglio presses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How're they getting into the U.S. Mint to use the presses?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In 1959, the United States was very friendly with the Shah of Iran.  We wanted his oil, so for the Shah's birthday, the government gave him a gift -- a U.S. Treasury Intaglio press.  The only one to ever leave the country.  Five years ago Ricky Tan bought that press on the black market.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five years ago?!   (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right before he left the force. Lee and Carter exchange looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't hard to spot the fakes until this past year.  Then Tan got hold of one of a kind Swiss made hundred dollar plates -- and started making superbills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (understanding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Hu Li killed him for the plates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  They've printed and shipped one hundred million dollars, and there's only one way to spot a fake. Isabella lights a HUNDRED DOLLAR BILL on fire, and it bur RED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They use an optical transfer ink from India that burns red -- the real ink burns black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are they going to do with a hundred million dollars in funny money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The real question is, where are the plates?  If we can find the plates, we can stop the whole operation. Isabella thinks for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe that's where you can help us.  Carter, this is your city, right? Carter nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Lee, you know Hu Li and the Triads? Lee nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, find out where Hu Li's keeping the plates. (hands Lee a card with a phone number)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome aboard, gentlemen.  From this moment on, you're working for the United States Secret Service. Isabella opens the door to let Lee and Carter out.  They quickly, trying to hide their excitement.  CAMERA STAYS o Isabella as she takes out her CELL PHONE, punches in a number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sterling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee and Carter are officially out of the Secret Service's way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee and Carter, both wearing dark sunglasses, walk throug the street trying their best to look like Secret Service Agents.  They approach Carter's parked VETTE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Secret Service Agent Carter.  This is my calling, Lee.  Give me six months and I'll be in Washington protecting a white guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We both know you would never take a bullet for someone else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't know that.  What are they gonna do, try and shoot the President during the interview?  I'll bet Isabella can pull some strings.  You saw the way she was staring at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She never even looked at you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just jealous 'cos the girl picked me.  I'm tall, dark and handsome, you're third world ugly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not third world ugly.  Women like me, they think I'm cute.  Like Snoopy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snoopy is about six inches taller than you.  I'm sorry, Lee, you never had a chance. Carter's had the last word, he gets into the Vette.  Lee reluctantly gets in, too.  EXT. CRENSHAW KITCHEN - CHINESE SOUL FOOD RESTAURANT - NI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter's Vette pulls up in front of a hole in the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter and Lee pass through the restaurant, only two tabl are occupied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter and Lee enter the busy kitchen where the OWNER, a BLACK MAN named KENNY, is yelling in Chinese to an over worked waiter.  Kenny's wife, a spectacular looking Chine woman, works the stove.  A couple of cute half-black, hal Asian kids run around the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenny!  How you doin'? Kenny looks up at Carter.  A cool, appraising glance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the action tonight?  The house making out okay? Kenny follows as Carter opens a door to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEN seated around several card tables, playing MAH-JONGG big money.  Lee and Kenny follow Carter inside.  It's ver smokey and very crowded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kenny)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is where I say I'm LAPD in a loud voice, they all scream and run and shit.  Watch.  It's real funny. Kenny grabs Carter's shoulder, pulling him aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenny leads Carter and Lee in, closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hear you got your ass kicked in Hong Kong, James.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What??  Where'd you hear that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got my sources.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I got mine, meaning you.  Nice how that works out. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm serious this time, I'm closing this place down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James, you see my kids back there?  You know how much I'm paying for private school?  How can you come in here with this attitude, you being little Chang's godfather?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little Chang is gonna have to go visit his daddy in jail if you don't cooperate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jail!?  James, you better back off.  Badge or no badge, I'll kick your ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to see you try. Kenny takes a step back and throws a lightning fast marti arts move.  Lee gets in front of Carter to protect him -- countering Kenny's move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Lee)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're on, then. Kenny throws out another precision martial arts sequence Lee BLOCKS -- Kenny ends in an advanced fighting stance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impressed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a good Twisting Tiger -- where did you learn that? They switch to Chinese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master Ching taught me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Praying Mantis school, in Bejing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Freddy Ching's, in Crenshaw. Lee smiles, Carter looks back and forth from Lee to Kenny

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing hanging out with Baby Duck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby Duck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what we all used to call him when he was a kid -- cause he was always quacking.  Never shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard that. Lee and Kenny laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I need some info and I don't have time to play around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this about the funny money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been asking loud questions in all the wrong places all morning.  How come you always save me for last, James?  When are you gonna learn.  Shit don't happen I don't know about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So tell me what you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know Teddy Wu is cranking out a pretty good double sawbuck -- but you knew that too, didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  We already been there.  This is big, Kenny.  Benjamins.  Secret Service calls 'em superbills.  Banks can't even tell the difference. Kenny considers this for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of my regulars lost fifty thousand dollars at the table here last week.  I was about to send my boys down to tune his ass up, when the guy comes in and pays off the whole thing.  Including the vig -- brand new sequential hundred dollar bills.  I knew something was wrong.  Cause this guy's got a regular job, no way he comes up with fifty grand in cash.  But I tested the bills, infrared.  The whole thing.  And they checked out.  100%.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you still have the bills?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still have my lunch money from third grade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme see 'em. Kenny pushes a Chinese painting aside to reveal a WALL SA He opens the safe and hands Carter a $100 bill.  Carter checks it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See.  It's perfect. Carter takes out a LIGHTER and holds the flame to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, what are you doing? Kenny's question is answered as the BILL BURNS BRIGHT RED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pissed off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew it.  The guy's name is Zing.  He works at the kitchen at Reign Plaza.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
